storyInfo: Siege opens the door to the Mausoleum of Kings, and a millennium of Victorian history surges toward her.

attributes.content: So this is...
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The giant door lies solemnly in the underground area. There is not a sound to be heard aside from the breathing of those who have made their way here.
Of course, death is silent. Not even the most glorious reign can change that fact.
The Mausoleum of Kings... Just as its name suggests... this is the resting place of all Victoria's kings.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Do you hear something?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Nothing besides our breathing.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: There is no mistaking that there is some kind of sound echoing throughout this space.
Is it a murmur she hears, having woken up from her dream, or is it a groan she owes to her fatigue?
They are staring at her.
Victoria is staring at her.
The moment she comes to realize this, a sense of agitation immediately follows.
What do they expect? What kind of future are they envisioning for her?
She grew tired of these days on the run long ago.
And it has been a very long time since she last heeded the call of that golden creature.
Come. We need to finish this mission as fast as we can.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Rhodes Island and the Corps will need our help.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Stop!
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: What's this... on the ground...?
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: It's too dark here... I thought this was some of that upper crust posh decor.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: This is blood.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Signs of a fight here.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: An utterly tragic battle... No, this place is a mire soaked in death.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: A meandering trail of blood can be found having slithering down the pathway and past the gap beneath the door. Or perhaps it crept its way out the large door.
The trail of blood has long since dried, leaving the shattered bricks on the ground covered in its twisted, dark crimson stains.
Likewise, there are tattered bolt heads, sword fragments, and craters left behind by Arts explosions, all submerged under the bed of dried blood.
There are also marks more massive in scale, such as the numerous scars on the door, each one by itself more than enough to tear the silence of this place asunder.
Although there are no bodies to be seen, everyone who seen war before can easily work out what transpired here.
Two groups, both prepared to fight to the death, battled each other. Evidently, they got their wish.
Judging from the color of the blood, this must be at least several years old.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Several years... You don't mean...
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Sarkaz died here.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I recognize their weapons. They're... the same ones the Sarkaz warriors who attacked the Knights of the Tower used all those years ago.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: They're different from what the Sarkaz outside are using.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Completely different.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: The blades that the Sarkaz use now are all made in the munitions factories in Highbury, and they're very similar to the standard weapons used by the Victorian Army.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: They're not as crude, and nowhere near as... barbaric.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I still remember... the sounds of their rusted blades cutting through my fellow knights. They were heavy, and they'd shatter bone before crushing armor.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Dagda, are you alright?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I'm fine.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: If the sight of these battle scars was enough to stop me in my tracks, I probably wouldn't have been able to manage a single peaceful night since my escape from Londinium.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Vina... The situation's not quite what we expected.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The sound hurts her head.
They are urging her. They are speaking.
The Sighs of Kings is still inside.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Keep calm and carry on.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Who fought the Sarkaz?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: There's no way to tell.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: The other side left no traces?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If they did, it's likely I haven't seen them before.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Mr. Totter. How long has it been since you became a mercenary?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It'll be my fourteenth anniversary next month.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: You must've seen weapons from most countries out there.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Certainly, but not every country out there.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: I'm just your garden variety merc. I haven't seen the weapons of any particularly elite forces.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: If I had, I wouldn't be alive right now.
attributes.name: Totter

attributes.content: Morgan, Indra. Head back outside the path and stay alert.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Secure our evac route, just like before, right?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I hope I don't miss out on anything good.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Siege, we can't act rashly now...
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: Do you hear the battle above us, Dagda?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Dagda

attributes.content: I do. This trembling... I can imagine it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I can't go back empty-handed.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: If the sword will stop all of this, or even just ease all the sacrifice and slaughter...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Then I shall do it.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I do not see this as a responsibility. It's just... a tiny act on my part.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: It's nothing different from knocking out the front teeth of those thugs who come looking for trouble.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina...
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Allerdale, you said it yourself. Having taken this step, we can't turn back now.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: You look pretty cheesed.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Hmph, this was my chance to fight right beneath the palace!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I just hope they don't actually run into anything that calls for a fight.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Eh, you should know what a big sacrifice I'm making for you. If someone whacks you in one go, you've got to have a friend to yell for the others, right?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Haha, my silly Hannah.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Do you remember how Vina looked when we first met her?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: How could I forget?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: She was real cocky.
attributes.name: Indra
Morgan
attributes.content: She was tiny, but she was full of herself, she hardly talked. You couldn't even tell when she was angry, but when she fought...

attributes.name: Morgan
attributes.content: Haha... Who do you reckon taught her how to fight?
She said it was her teacher.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: And I thought she had some brawler from Norport for a teacher.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Then we found out about who she was, and it all made sense. Probably a knight with muscles for brains.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Seriously, though, aren't princes and princesses all meant to wear frilly clothes and have trouble running? What kind of teacher would have her fighting like she's facing a wild beast?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Haha, when she first told us who she was, I thought she was having a laugh.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina wouldn't kid about something where life and death is concerned.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I thought it was a new gang looking for trouble with Glasgow.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But it turns out it was an operation to assassinate the heir to the throne? Hah.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: They were pretty tough, though.
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: I thought it'd be a lot more fun to follow a crown princess on an adventure than living the thug life. Besides, this princess has got a special place in my heart.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Before I knew it, we were following Vina out of Londinium, wandering the world with her, and making it back here.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Now... If the heroes in the legends had a choice, they'd rather lie down on the sofa and gulp down a cold beer, wouldn't you agree?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Having second thoughts?
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Of course not. We've come this far already.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I started on my memoirs already, and I'm going to make a huge with the book! It's called The Legendary Vina and Her Legendary Mates. All I need now is a publisher.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: With your sorry vocabulary? Forget it!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Vina said it was cool!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: This reminds me... of that pub that we smashed the sign of.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: That was the first battle we won with Vina leading us!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: That night, we drank all the booze in their cellar. In the end, Baird carried us back to the lorry, one by one, and drove us home before the police got there.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Are you bloody daft? I was the one who carried you on my back. Baird was so off her trolley, she tried to steer the loo! And you wanted her to drive?!
attributes.name: Indra

attributes.content: Haha.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: All I'm thinking is... No matter where we are, we can still come together and make a name for ourselves, right? Even if it's just taking over a pub from the other gangs.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Say, Hannah...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We've been back for days already. Why hasn't Vina so much as suggested paying Glasgow a visit?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: The key.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Before we left, the Doctor gave me this key.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The Doctor told me that Dr. Kal'tsit negotiated for this... Only this can open the door that leads to the Mausoleum of Kings.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I know this key once belonged to a Draco.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: ...Allerdale.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Do you know... where the other key is?
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: The other key.
The key that belonged to the Aslan royal family. It, too, can open this door, and it should have been passed to her by her father, but she has never seen the key herself.
Why ask me that, all of a sudden?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I just remembered... another legend about the Sighs of Kings.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.text: 'With the sword in his hand, the Aslan padishah tried to conquer the last swath of foreign land.'
'The Draco king's fire Arts flew straight toward him. His armor burned away in the flames, disappearing in purplish drops. However, his sword was far harder than his armor.'
'The moment it pierced the Draco king's body, only half of the Aslan padishah's sword remained.'
'And so, the Draco king lived, and the Aslan padishah lost his right hand.'
'After the Draco and the Aslan signed their treaty, the sword was reforged, and it has since become the symbol of Victoria's centuries-long glory.'

attributes.content: My ancestors... once nearly killed a Draco king.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: And now I hold the key of the Red Dragon's descendants...
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: ...to open the door to the Mausoleum of Kings.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Here, it doesn't matter whether one is Draco or Aslanâ€”
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: One is only Victoria.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The door opens.
It is much easier than she imagined. It's so simple, as though everything was already in place, awaiting only this tiny push from her.
The Mausoleum of Kingsâ€”
A millennium of Victorian history surges toward her, the Aslan who left, only to return.
